definitions: Pulled (someone or something) along forcefully, roughly, or with difficulty.
Caused (someone) to go somewhere they did not want to go.
Extended or continued for an unnecessarily long time.
Searched the bottom of a body of water with a dragnet or hook.
examples: He dragged the heavy box across the floor.
She was dragged into the argument.
The meeting dragged on for hours.
They dragged the river for the missing item.
